title: No fuel shortage in the country: CPC
byline: The Chairman of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) assured the public that there is no shortage of fuel in the country and that distribution is continuing as usual.

title: We will downsize security forces: President
byline: Number of persons in all three armed forces will be reduced while they will be made sophisticated with equipment, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: Muslims to commence Ramadan fasting on Sunday
byline: Muslims in Sri Lanka will begin the Holy month of Ramadan on Sunday, (02), since the new moon for the month was not sighted today, the Colombo Grand Mosque announced a short while ago.

title: Expenditure head for Defence Ministry approved
byline: The expenditure head of the Defence Ministry was approved in Parliament by a majority of 78 votes with 88 members voting in favour and ten against.

title: Court orders arrest of Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has issued an order for the arrest of former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon over the Weligama shooting incident in 2023, police said today.

title: PTA will be repealed
byline: The Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will be repealed, but new laws to curb crime and prevent extremism will be introduced soon, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: Politicians, legal officers, police, security forces patronising underworld: President
byline: A number of sectors including political leaders, legal officers, security officers and police are patronising the underworld, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake told Parliament today.

title: No price revision for LAUGFS gas in March
byline: There will be no price revision for LAUGFS Gas domestic cylinder refills in March, LAUGFS Gas Director and Cluster CEO Dr. Niroshan J. Pieries said.

title: President attends parliamentary debate
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake arrived in Parliament a short while to take part in the debate on the expenditure allocation for the Ministry of Defence.

title: Government clarifies how AKD visited three countries at a cost of Rs. 1.8 mn
byline: Responding to allegations of how President Anura Kumara Dissanayake managed to visit three countries for just Rs. 1.8 million, Chief Government Whip Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said that only Rs. 1.2 million was spent for the Indian visit, Rs. 386,000 for the China visit and Rs. 279,970 for the Dubai visit.

title: Bloemendhal railway crossing to close for 16 hours from tomorrow: Railways Dept.
byline: The railway line leading to the harbour from Orugodawatta will be closed for two days for 16 hours from tomorrow, the Sri Lanka  Railways Department said.

title: Microsoft to shut down Skype in May this year: Report
byline: Skype, the video calling platform that made headlines in the early 2000s, may finally be shutting down. While the service isn’t as popular as it used to be, Microsoft claims that more than 36 million people used Skype daily to connect with their friends, family and colleagues.

title: Remove MPs parliamentary privileges to prevent them from lying: Namal
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa today proposed to remove the privilge of MPs to tell lies in Parliament just like the removal of MPs’ permits and insurance.

title: Committee on High Posts approves new HC to Australia, Ambassador to Bahrain
byline: The Committee on High Posts has approved the appointment of a new Ambassador and High Commissioner.

title: Foreign digital service providers can retain overseas earnings amid tax increase: Handunneththi
byline: The tax burden on individuals providing services to foreign countries while residing in Sri Lanka has increased. However, they have the option to keep their income abroad without bringing it into the country. Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Minister Sunil Handunneththi said that he does not agree with this tax.

title: Colombo District Court dismisses action against Sri Lanka Schools Cricket Association
byline: Colombo District Court Judge Sandun Vithana, yesterday dismissed a Plaint filed by Deputy Principal, Mahanama Vidyalaya, Colombo 3 against the office-bearers of the Sri Lanka Schools Cricket Association (SLSCA) including its Acting President Thilak Waththuhewa, Secretary, and Treasurer, and vacated an enjoining order obtained on 11th February by which the Plaintiff had sought an Interim Injunction preventing the playing of the Semi-Final of the U

title: Sri Lanka opens for renegotiation with Adani on tariff rates
byline: Despite Indian conglomerate Adani Group’s announcement that it withdrew from the US $ 442 million wind power project in Mannar, the Energy Ministry has requested the company to inform its stand in writing on the future of the project since Sri Lanka remains open for renegotiation of tariffs quoted originally, an official said.

title: IMF releases US$334mn to Sri Lanka
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) announced its Executive Board has ​completed the third review under the 48-month Extended Fund Facility (EFF) Arrangement, allowing the authorities to draw SDR 254 million (about US$334 million).

title: Fuel distributors to halt orders from midnight
byline: The Fuel Distributors’ Association announced that they will cease fuel ordering activities from midnight today (28 February).

title: Uproar in Parliament over fuel issue
byline: Parliament went into an uproar over the fuel distribution issue after ruling party members charged that there is a sinister move to create a fuel scarcity.

title: Sri Lanka open for renegotiation with Adani on tariff rates
byline: Despite Indian conglomerate Adani Group’s announcement that it withdrew from the US $ 442 million wind power project in Mannar, the Energy Ministry has requested the company to inform its stand in writing on the future of the project since Sri Lanka remains open for renegotiation of tariffs quoted originally, an official said.

title: Ranil meets Modi in New Delhi
byline: Former President Ranil  Wickremesinghe, at the NXT Conclave event in New Delhi, met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi where the two held discussions.

title: Ukraine crisis a reminder for Sri Lanka on the importance of non-alignment
byline: In a world increasingly polarized by great-power rivalries, Sri Lanka must remain steadfast in its time tested foreign policy doctrine: non-alignment, former Foreign Affairs Minister Ali Sabry said.

title: Govt must ensure diesel supply for public transport if shortage persists: Gemunu
byline: If the fuel shortage continues, the government must take immediate action to ensure sufficient diesel supply from the Sri Lanka Transport Board (SLTB) depots to maintain smooth public transportation, the Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) said.

title: Fuel distributors stick to their guns
byline: Fuel distributors said they would continue with their position not to place orders despite the government agreeing to a meeting with them on Tuesday.

title: Travel ban imposed on Deshabandu Tennakoon
byline: The Matara Magistrate’s Court has issued an overseas travel ban on former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon.
